intro: Allium maowenense, commonly known as the Maowen onion, is a perennial bulbous plant native to China. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clustered, spherical bulbous structures. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
